title: Total subset
summary: In mathematics, more specifically in functional analysis, a subset T {\displaystyle T} of a topological vector space X {\displaystyle X} is said to be a total subset of X {\displaystyle X} if the linear span of T {\displaystyle T} is a dense subset of X . {\displaystyle X.} [1] This condition arises frequently in many theorems of functional analysis.
